Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.Client
public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
Client class handles all what is related to network for client-side. In particular, this project is based on a distributed client-server approach through socket: client is the "place" from which a player sends commands to server, where he/she receives updates, ...; it connects to server's specific (IP,port) and shares appropriate objects with it. Network connection between client and server is based on TCP.

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client() throws java.io.IOException
      The constructor creates a Client object and initializes client-server socket connection. Server is supposed to be active on specified IP and PORT.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if connection can't be established, for any reason (network error, unavailable server, ...)

  • Method Details

    • initConnection

      private void initConnection() throws java.io.IOException
      This private method establishes effective connection between Client object and server. Streams for socket communication, both input and output, are created.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if connection can't be established, for any reason (network error, unavailable server, ...)

    • reinitializeConnection

      public void reinitializeConnection() throws java.io.IOException
      The method's task is to initialize a client-server socket connection from an already existing Client object; so, this method differs from constructor because the object exists. The method's main usage is that of establishing a new connection after closing one: in fact, after a match, a player can decide to play another match; in this case, this method is called, in order to have a new connection to server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if connection can't be established, for any reason (network error, unavailable server, ...)

    • setupUpdateListener

      public void setupUpdateListener() throws java.io.IOException
      This method initializes listener for updates coming from Server; in fact, client and server send/receive objects through socket. In this method, ping message sender is created too, and it becomes active: this allows server to control if all clients are connected (if not, the match must immediately end).
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the output stream or if the socket is not connected

    • sendPlayersNumber

      public void sendPlayersNumber​(int playersNum) throws java.io.IOException
      This method sends to server the number of players selected for the match. A Santorini match can be played by 2 or 3 people, and every player decides, before the match itself, his/her opponent's number.
      Parameters:
      playersNum - number of players of the match: must be 2 or 3
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readPlayerID

      public java.lang.String readPlayerID() throws java.io.IOException
      This method simply returns a String representing the unique ID given to player by server.
      Returns:
      unique player ID given by server
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when doing some of the operations (like reading or closing socket, if server is unavailable)

    • sendCommand

      public void sendCommand​(Command command)
      The method sends a Command, generated client-side, to server. In general, Client sends Commands to Server, while receives Updates from it.
      Parameters:
      command - the command to send to server, through socket

    • getUpdateListener

      public UpdateListener getUpdateListener()
      This method is the getter for UpdateListener of Client Class; UpdateListener is Client's listener, always ready to receive objects form Server.
      Returns:
      updateListener attribute of Client class

    • isServerReachable

      private boolean isServerReachable()
      The method checks whether server is reachable through network (socket) or not. Remind that server is supposed to be "located" at (IP,PORT) attributes.
      Returns:
      true if server is reachable, so a socket connection with servercan be established; false otherwise
